results.title: It's a hobby for Harvey
results.creator_credit: Barry Lank Productions and Barry Lank
results.brief_description: Shows champion whistler Harvey Pollock, a Canadian lawyer by profession, as he performs at regional contests and programs and with the Winnipeg Symphony Orchestra. Pollock’s love of whistling carries over to his personal life as he is seen warbling the strains of classical music at home, in his automobile, on horseback, in the swimming pool, and on his boat.

results.title: It's a dangerous world
results.brief_description: An informational film promoting the benefits of undertaking a first aid course by alerting viewers to a myriad of domestic hazards. Shows the attitude of an ordinary person to accidents in all fields. The extent of deaths and injuries from accidents; how various types of accidents happen.

results.title: It's a crime
results.creator_credit: ONF | NFB, Tom Daly and Wolf Koenig
results.brief_description: An animated film, in a humorous vein, showing how seasonal unemployment may be greatly lessened if industry, and the public generally, avail themselves of the increased labor supply during winter lay-offs. The advice comes from someone who knows—a gentleman thief and safecracker whose nefarious but highly skilled profession gives him a particular advantage in assessing the state of business, and the contents of strong boxes, during the winter fall-off of work. How the situation may be rectified with a little foresight and imagination is amply and amusingly illustrated. Animation by Gerald Potterton and commentary by Guy Glover.
results.creator_credit_for_label: ONF | NFB, Tom Daly and Wolf Koenig

results.title: It's a business doing pleasure
results.creator_credit: Open Channel Productions, John Moore and Sharon Connolly
results.brief_description: An intelligent look at prostitution, focusing on sex workers, Vicky and Gillian, two of the thousands of women working in the sex industry in Victoria. They work in one of Melbourne’s legal brothels and give a detailed explanation of the practicality of their work, of which sex is only one component. Vicky and Gillian earn more than women in low skill jobs, but experience none of the benefits of other wage earners. Also covers the work of the Prostitutes’ Collective of Victoria.

results.title: It'll be alright on the night. 3
results.creator_credit: London Weekend Television and Paul Smith
results.brief_description: Written and presented by English comedian, Denis Norden, this program features as part of a television series on British television. Shows a collection of bloopers and stuff-ups in the film and television industry in Great Britain and America from feature films to commercials to soap-operas to current affairs programs.

results.title: It
results.creator_credit: Famous Players-Lasky Corporation, Producciones del Escorpión S.L., Paramount Pictures and Clarence Badger
results.brief_description: A light romantic comedy based on Elinor Glyn’s widely read novella, which provided a popular showcase for Clara Bow’s talent. As a salesgirl with Glyn’s magnetic ‘It’ quality, she attracts the eligible store owner. Without straying far from the straight and narrow, Bow’s upwardly-mobile working class flapper manages to combine an unselfconscious sensuality, wit and charm with a hint of wildness. Cast includes Clara Bow, Antonio Moreno, William Austin, Gary Cooper and Elinor Glyn.

results.title: Issues in psychology
results.creator_credit: Coastline Community College, David Stone and Harry Ratner
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Psychology: the study of human behavior”.
Psychology is a dynamic, diverse discipline concerned with the study of the human condition. What are the major issues in, and impact of, psychology today? To examine this question, a panel of US psychologists are assembled including psychobiologist, James McGaugh, social psychologist, Lee Ross, cognitive/social psychologist, Elizabeth Loftus, and Professor Joseph White, a developmental psychologist.
